usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script utilizes getERoofPlane() and getElement() to select model entities. It generates 3D construction elements using Beam.dbCreate(). No 'sd_' prefixes, Viewport interactions, or dimension drawing logic found. Ends with eraseInstance() typical of constructive generation scripts.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: 3D Model Space containing at least one Roof Plane and one Reference Element

scriptPurpose.summary: Automatically generates a structural Gable Ladder (ladder frame) at a roof gable end, including longitudinal rafters and cross blocking (dwangs), based on a selected roof plane and reference element.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Used to frame the vertical triangular ends of a pitched roof (gable ends) to provide fixing for cladding, soffits, and barge boards, ensuring the structure matches the roof pitch and depth.

parameters.name: sCompName
parameters.businessMeaning: The identifier name for the manufacturing component (Element). If specified, the script groups the generated beams into a specific production element.
parameters.affectsOutput: Enables the creation of a hierarchical Element entity containing the beams, rather than just loose beams. Requires a valid Floor Group to be active.

parameters.name: sNotes
parameters.businessMeaning: User-defined notes or labels attached to the generated element for informational purposes on drawings or reports.
parameters.affectsOutput: Metadata added to the element properties.

parameters.name: sDimStyle
parameters.businessMeaning: The dimension style applied to any dimensions generated within the element creation process.
parameters.validRange: Existing dimension style name in the drawing
parameters.affectsOutput: Visual appearance of dimensions in associated shop drawings.

parameters.name: dWidth
parameters.businessMeaning: The thickness of the timber used for the ladder rafters and blocking.
parameters.affectsOutput: Width of all generated rectangular beams.

parameters.name: dHeight
parameters.businessMeaning: The depth of the timber used for the ladder rafters and blocking.
parameters.affectsOutput: Depth of all generated beams and vertical positioning calculation relative to the roof plane.

parameters.name: sMaterial
parameters.businessMeaning: The material grade or type of timber (e.g., CLS - Canadian Lumber Standard).
parameters.validRange: Material codes defined in the CAD standards (e.g., CLS, C24)
parameters.affectsOutput: Assigns material properties for scheduling and rendering.

parameters.name: sGrade
parameters.businessMeaning: The structural strength grade of the timber.
parameters.affectsOutput: Structural property data for engineering calculations.

parameters.name: dBackSpan
parameters.businessMeaning: The horizontal depth of the ladder frame perpendicular to the wall/roof run, i.e., the length of the cross blocking.
parameters.affectsOutput: Length of the cross dwangs (blocking) connecting the two ladder rafters.

parameters.name: dThicknessSpandrel
parameters.businessMeaning: The vertical setback or thickness of the spandrel structure; determines how far the top of the ladder sits from the reference element origin.
parameters.affectsOutput: Vertical offset of the ladder geometry relative to the reference element.

parameters.name: dDistribution
parameters.businessMeaning: The maximum on-center spacing between the cross blocking (dwangs) along the length of the ladder.
parameters.affectsOutput: Frequency and count of cross dwangs generated.

parameters.name: dMinLength
parameters.businessMeaning: The minimum acceptable length for a timber segment at the end of the run or between splits.
parameters.affectsOutput: If the remaining space is less than this, the script will omit the last cross dwang or adjust spacing.

parameters.name: dOffsetBlocking
parameters.businessMeaning: The distance from the eave end of the ladder to the center of the first cross blocking.
parameters.affectsOutput: Position of the first cross dwang relative to the eave line.

parameters.name: sOrientation
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines whether the ladder sits 'Below Plane' (standard infill) or 'Above Plane' (applied externally).
parameters.affectsOutput: Vertical shift of the ladder geometry relative to the selected Roof Plane.

parameters.name: dMaxTimberLength
parameters.businessMeaning: The maximum available length of raw timber stock. Used to determine if and where to scarf/join the ladder rafters.
parameters.affectsOutput: Splits long ladder rafters into multiple pieces joined at cross blocking locations.

parameters.name: nColor
parameters.businessMeaning: The display color of the generated beams in the CAD model.
parameters.affectsOutput: Visual color of the created entities.

parameterDependencies.effect: Triggers the 'hsb_CreateElement' logic to group beams into a manufacturing Element. Requires a valid Floor Group context.
Splits the longitudinal ladder rafters into segments at the max length intervals.
Recalculates the array of cross dwangs. Ensures spacing does not leave a gap smaller than dMinLength.
Adjusts the 'Plumb Height' calculation (dHeight / sin(pitch)), shifting the ladder vertically if orientation is 'Below Plane'.

outputEntities.description: Ladder Rafter: Two longitudinal beams running parallel to the roof slope (Outside and Inside). These may be split into multiple beams if they exceed dMaxTimberLength.
Cross Dwang (Code 'MD'): Transverse beams connecting the ladder rafters. Spaced according to dDistribution.
Mid Dwang (Code 'CD'): Short blocking members placed between cross dwangs if the spacing permits.
Manufacturing Element: If sCompName is used, groups the beams into elements per segment (split to split) for production.

workflowDiagram: [Conditional: On Insert?] Check if _bOnInsert is true
Conditional: [Is Component Name populated AND Floor Group invalid?]
[True] Show Error: 'Make a floor group current...', Erase Instance, Exit
Store selected Element and Roof Plane data
Validate Element and Roof Plane validity
Calculate Plumb Height based on dHeight and Roof Pitch
Adjust Roof Plane Geometry (Transform based on orientation)
Calculate Split Points for Long Rafters (dMaxTimberLength)
[If Length > Max] Generate split points at intervals
Determine Distribution Points for Cross Dwangs (dDistribution, dOffsetBlocking)
[If Space Left < dMinLength] Omit last distribution to maintain min length
Generate Mid Dwangs (between Cross Dwangs if spacing permits)
[Conditional: Create Elements?] Check if sCompName is populated
[True] Group beams into Manufacturing Elements based on split points

path1.name: Element Creation Mode
steps: Validate that a valid Floor Group is current (namePart 0 and 1 exist)
Generate beams
Sort beams by Ladder Segments (defined by Max Timber Length splits)
Call 'hsb_CreateElement' for each segment to group beams into manufacturing elements
Pass DimStyle, Name, Notes, and Color to the new elements

path2.name: Standard Construction Mode
steps: Generate loose beams in Model Space
No Floor Group validation required
No 'hsb_CreateElement' TSL instances generated

conditionalBranches.condition: Total Ladder Length compared to dMaxTimberLength

path1.name: Continuous Ladder
steps: Generate two Ladder Rafters (Outside/Inside) as single beams
No splitting logic executed

path2.name: Spliced Ladder
steps: Calculate split points along the rafter length at dMaxTimberLength intervals
Generate two Ladder Rafters
Split the Rafters at calculated points (creating multiple beams)
If Element Creation is active, create separate elements for each segment between splits

path1.name: Below Plane
steps: Calculate Plumb Height (dHeight / sin(pitch))
Do not transform the Roof Plane origin/profile (Default position)

path2.name: Above Plane
steps: Calculate Plumb Height
Transform Roof Plane origin and profile up by (Plumb Height * Z-Vector)
Ladder generates at this elevated position

conditionalBranches.condition: Remaining Space in Distribution Loop vs dMinLength

path1.name: Valid Spacing
steps: Place Cross Dwang at calculated distribution point
Loop continues until distance < dDistribution

path2.name: Insufficient Space
steps: Distance to next point is < dMinLength
Flag to NOT add the final potential point
Exit distribution loop early
Last placed dwang remains further from the end than dDistribution

validationRules.check: Is a valid Floor Group active?
validationRules.errorMessage: \nMake a floor group current before inserting Gable
validationRules.recovery: User must set a valid Floor Group current in the CAD model before running the script again.

validationRules.check: Is a valid Reference Element selected?
validationRules.recovery: User must ensure they click a valid structural element when prompted.

validationRules.check: Is a valid Roof Plane selected?
validationRules.recovery: User must select a valid Roof Plane object during the insert command.

validationRules.check: Does the Ladder intersect the Roof Plane (Area > 1sq unit)?
validationRules.recovery: User must ensure the Reference Element is positioned such that the ladder dimensions (Back Span, Spandrel Thickness) actually overlap the Roof Plane geometry.

postInsertionActions.effect: Script recalculates geometry, deletes old beams, and generates new ones. Ladder adapts to new sizes immediately.
Ladder moves vertically relative to the roof plane to match the new setting.
Number and position of Cross Dwangs updates. Old dwangs are deleted, new ones created.

postInsertionActions.how: Grip edit on Reference Element or Roof Plane (if script supports dynamic updates via re-calc, though TSL usually requires property edit or regenerate)
postInsertionActions.effect: If the Reference Element moves, updating the script (e.g. via 'Update' command or changing a property) will move the ladder to the new position.
Switches between loose beams and grouped Manufacturing Elements (requires Floor Group context).

data.markdown:
# hsb_Ladder.mcr

## Overview
Automatically generates a structural Gable Ladder (ladder frame) at a roof gable end. It creates longitudinal rafters and cross blocking (dwangs) based on a selected roof plane and a reference element to facilitate cladding and barge board fixing.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Script generates 3D construction beams here. |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for this script. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Not applicable for this script. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**:
  - 1x Roof Plane (`ERoofPlane`)
  - 1x Reference Element (e.g., a wall plate or beam defining the gable position)
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 0
- **Required Settings**:
  - A valid **Floor Group** must be set current if you intend to use the "Gable Ladder Name" (Element creation) feature.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `hsb_Ladder.mcr`

### Step 2: Configure Initial Properties (Optional)
A "Properties" dialog will appear automatically upon insertion. You can accept the defaults or adjust key dimensions (like Width, Height, and Distribution) here. You can also change these later in the Properties Palette.

### Step 3: Select Roof Plane
```
Command Line: Select Roofplane
Action: Click on the Roof Plane that defines the pitch and geometry for the gable end.
```

### Step 4: Select Reference Element
```
Command Line: Select Reference Element
Action: Click on the structural element (e.g., top plate or trimmer) that positions the ladder vertically and horizontally.
```

### Step 5: Generation
The script calculates the geometry, generates the ladder beams, and groups them (if a Component Name is provided). The script instance erases itself, leaving only the construction beams.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Gable Ladder Name (sCompName) | Text | GL1 | Name of the manufacturing component. If filled, groups beams into an Element. |
| Notes (sNotes) | Text | | User notes for the element. |
| Dimstyle (sDimStyle) | Dropdown | _DimStyles | Dimension style applied to the element. |
| Timber Width (dWidth) | Number | 38 | Thickness of the timber used for rafters and blocking (mm). |
| Timber Height (dHeight) | Number | 90 | Depth of the timber used for rafters and blocking (mm). |
| Material (sMaterial) | Text | CLS | Material code (e.g., CLS). |
| Grade (sGrade) | Text | C16 | Structural grade of the timber. |
| Back Span (dBackSpan) | Number | 650 | Horizontal depth of the ladder frame (length of cross blocking) in mm. |
| Thickness Spandrel (dThicknessSpandrel) | Number | 101 | Vertical setback/offset of the ladder top from the reference element (mm). |
| Distribution (dDistribution) | Number | 600 | On-center spacing between cross blocking/dwang (mm). |
| Minimum Length (dMinLength) | Number | 150 | Minimum allowable length for the last timber segment (mm). |
| Sides Offset Cross Blocking (dOffsetBlocking) | Number | 20 | Distance from the eave end to the center of the first cross dwang (mm). |
| Alignment (sOrientation) | Dropdown | Below Plane | Sets ladder position: "Below Plane" (standard infill) or "Above Plane" (external). |
| Max Timber Length (dMaxTimberLength) | Number | 4780 | Maximum stock length. Rafters longer than this will be split. |
| Color (nColor) | Number | 171 | AutoCAD color index for the generated beams. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| (None Specified) | This script does not add custom items to the right-click context menu. Use the Properties Palette (Ctrl+1) to modify parameters and regenerate the ladder. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: None
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: This script does not rely on external settings files; all configuration is done via the Properties Palette.

## Tips
- **Element Creation**: If you provide a "Gable Ladder Name", ensure a Floor Group is active in the drawing. If not, the script will display an error and erase itself.
- **Splitting Rafters**: If your gable is very long, the script will automatically splice the longitudinal rafters at the interval defined in "Max Timber Length".
- **Spacing Logic**: The script ensures the last gap at the top of the ladder does not fall below the "Minimum Length" setting. If space is tight, it may adjust the top spacing.
- **Orientation**: Use "Alignment" > "Above Plane" if you are applying the ladder to the exterior of the roof structure, or "Below Plane" for standard infill.

## FAQ
- **Q: The script disappeared immediately after I selected the elements. Why?**
- **A:** This usually happens if you entered a "Gable Ladder Name" but did not have a valid Floor Group set current. Make a floor group current and try again. It can also happen if the Reference Element does not intersect the Roof Plane geometry.
- **Q: How do I change the spacing of the cross dwangs?**
- **A:** Select any of the generated beams and open the Properties Palette (Ctrl+1). Change the "Distribution" value, and the ladder will update automatically.
- **Q: Can I move the ladder up or down?**
- **A:** Yes. Use the "Thickness Spandrel" property to adjust the vertical position relative to the reference element, or change the "Alignment" to toggle between the inside and outside of the roof plane.
